intro: Euonymus sacrosanctus, commonly known as the sacred euonymus, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, small, greenish-white flowers that appear in late spring. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy and have a slightly serrated edge. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Euonymus sacrosanctus is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
